name: places/ChIJI-n-pFpYwokRLsxwkkVAobM
adrFormatAddress: 733 11th Ave, New York, NY 10019-5051, USA

originalText.text: I love the daily show. Trevor Noah left but the guest host are still amazing. Always a good time and even better when you see it live. I highly recommend getting tickets and being part of the audience when you are in NYC.

text.text: I love the daily show. Trevor Noah left but the guest host are still amazing. Always a good time and even better when you see it live. I highly recommend getting tickets and being part of the audience when you are in NYC.

originalText.text: Okay, so this was our first ever live audience recording and OMG it was so much fun. From the opening act that got us all hype to the reason we came in the first place John Leguizamo who had us laughing and thinking at the same time. Ronnie Chang was hilarious as always and the special guest Ana Navarro was so inspiring and uplifting I'm so honored to have witness it live and for free. Rumors have it if you watch the first episode with John Leguizamo you will see me and my wife in the intro üòè definitely recommend this to anyone in or around NYC or if your visitng

originalText.text: The Daily Show was a pleasant experience,  despite the wait.  We had non guaranteed tickets,  so it was up to chance...we were last to get in. Only 25-30 people got in from that line which had about 100 people. Lesson,  either get guaranteed seats,  or get in line early, by 3pm, otherwise chances are low.  Overall the show was worth the wait and Trevor and the crew did a good job.  Enjoy!

text.text: The Daily Show was a pleasant experience,  despite the wait.  We had non guaranteed tickets,  so it was up to chance...we were last to get in. Only 25-30 people got in from that line which had about 100 people. Lesson,  either get guaranteed seats,  or get in line early, by 3pm, otherwise chances are low.  Overall the show was worth the wait and Trevor and the crew did a good job.  Enjoy!

originalText.text:
Tickets are free so the catch is that you have to wait in the elements until you're let inside.  The process is very well rehearsed. Signage is clear and the security (and other staff) keep the guests informed. Certain areas outside of the studio are heated and before being seated, guests are encouraged to use the restrooms. Masks are required and provided by the studio. There's a less hostile TSA type security screening before you are gently herded to the actual studio where the show is taped.
The studio is small. It is wired for sound.  All the sounds. There's no "canned audience".  All the reactions are real and it requires a little more energy than you expect. There's some photography allowed before taping but it is forbidden after that. There are no breaks and they keep things moving. They keep you informed about what to expect: stage manger gives instructions; a warm up comedian does their thing; the host comes out and does their thing; the audience get to react to taped pieces; brief Q&A after the taping and then you're back in the elements.

originalText.text:
New studio opened April 2022 on 11th Ave, so there are still logistical kinks needing to be worked out during studio load in process.

Had priority tickets, arrived at 3:15pm and was person #84 in line. Waited in line for about 1.5 hours before sitting down due to some unknown show issues.

All seats are close to Trevor and with good views! #84 was about third row from front.

Capped water bottles are allowed in the studio. Photos/video are allowed in the studio before taping starts.

They play some music for about 15 minutes after everyone is seated.

Warm up comic started around 5:30pm. He does "crowd work" comedy.

We did laugh track for pre taped skits after comic.

Trevor came out around 6:00pm. He did a monologue, then answered audience questions, and then interviewed a guest.

After guest, the show ends and you quickly exit. We exited at 7:00pm.

Once we were seated, the experience was great!  Trevor was super friendly with the audience. I highly recommend it!
